title: Michael Scanlon (baseball)
text:
Michael B. Scanlon (November 1843 – January 18, 1929) was an <a href="Irish-American">Irish-American</a> <a href="professional%20baseball">professional baseball</a> <a href="Manager%20%28baseball%29">manager</a>.
Scanlon served as manager for two <a href="Major%20League%20Baseball">major league</a> teams; the <a href="1884%20Washington%20Nationals%20%28UA%29%20season">1884 Washington Nationals</a> of the <a href="Union%20Association">Union Association</a> and the <a href="1886%20Washington%20Nationals%20season">1886 Washington Nationals</a> of the <a href="National%20League">National League</a>. In 196 games as a manager, he won 60 games and lost 132 games for a .313 <a href="winning%20percentage">winning percentage</a>. Born in <a href="Cork%20%28city%29">Cork</a>, <a href="Ireland">Ireland</a>, Scanlon died in 1929 in <a href="Washington%2C%20D.C.">Washington, D.C.</a>
